_meanings:
(Declined like a 
pronoun when it implies relative 
position in time or space, but 
optionally so in <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab>; and <ab>abl.</ab> and
<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab>)

{@--1@} Being in front of,
first, foremost.

{@--5@} Former, previous,
interior, prior, antecedent (<ab>opp.</ab>
{#uttara#}); in this sense often at the
end of <ab>comp.</ab> and translated by
‘formerly’ or ‘before’; {#SrutapUrva#} &c.

{@--9@} Early, prime.
{#pUrve vayasi#} <ls>Pt. 1. 165</ls> ‘in early age
or prime of life.’

{@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a 
country to the east of Madhyadeśa.

the sacred fire
kept in the house ({#AvasaTA#}).

the eastern mountain
behind which the sun and moon
are supposed to rise.

the first occupant, a prior
owner.

the end of a 
preceding word.

{3} prior
and subsequent, preceding and 
following.

{3} the proof and the
thing to be proved.
turned towards or facing the east.

{3}
the first half of a hemistich.

<ab>N.</ab> of the 20th lunar mansion
consisting of two stars.

the preceding and
following, antecedent and 
subsequent.

{2} the first thing to be
done, a prior work.

{3} actions
done in a former life.

an act done in
a former life.

the starting
point of a debate, the first statement
or {#pUrvapakza#} <ab>q. v.</ab>

{1} born or
produced before or formerly,
first-produced, first-born.

{2} the son of the elder
wife.

{3} an ancestor, a forefather:
{#sa pUrvajAnAM kapilena rozAt#} <ls>R. 16. 34.</ls>

{5} the Manes living in the
world of the moon.

Indra, the regent of the
east.

a
progenitor ({#pitf#}) of gods or of men:
{#akroDanAH SOcaparAH satataM brahmacAriRaH .#} 
{#nyastaSastrA mahABAgAH pitaraH pUrvadevatAH ..#}.

the eastern country, or the eastern
part of India.

{2} the first half
of a lunar month.

{4}
the first objection to an argument.

the plaint, the
first stage of a legal proceeding.

the first member of a compound or
sentence.

the eastern 
mountain behind which the sun is 
supposed to rise.

({%<ab>m.</ab>%} <ab>pl.</ab>) the disciples of
Pāṇini living in the east.

{2} any one
of the first three ancestors, 
beginning with the father ({#pitf, pitAmaha#},
and {#prapitAmaha#}); <ls>Pt. 1. 89.</ls>

the eleventh
lunar mansion containing two stars

an epithet of the planet 
Jupiter.

the
twenty fifth lunar mansion 
containing two stars.

willing to speak
first; hence polite, courteous.

‘the prior or first 
Mīmāmsā’, an inquiry into the first or 
ritual portion of the Veda, as 
opposed to the {#uttaramImAMsA#} or {#vedAMta#}; see
{#mImAMsA#}.

the dawning or incipient
love, love between two persons
which springs (from some previous
cause) before their meeting;  
{#SravaRAddarSanAdvApi miTaH saMrUQarAgayoH .#} 
{#daSAviSezo'yo prAptO pUrvarAga sa ucyate ..#}.
<ls>S. D. 214.</ls>

the first part of
the night.

{3} the first of
two concurrent vowels or consonants
that is retained.

{4} (in <ab>Rhet.</ab>) a figure
of speech which consists in describing
anything as suddenly resuming its
former state.

the
first plea or commencement of an
action at law.

one who first
commences hostilities, an aggressor.

relating to the first half 

of autumn.
the upper part of the thigh.

the
first or heaviest of the three fines.
